node.title: Who is Eileen Gu and why the fascination?
node.alt: A Chinese female athlete stands with her gold medal at a ceremony at the Beijing Winter Olympics.
node.description: The US-born, Chinese gold medallist is far more than a sporting champion, having become an internationally recognised face used in a propaganda battle, writes Tracey Holmes.
node.content:
["In China, her name is GU Ailing. In the United States, it is Eileen Gu. In the Olympics, it translates to big ticket item.", "She's the American-born athlete representing\u00a0China, an 18-year-old who refers to herself as American when she's in America and Chinese when she's in China. That's dynamite in the current politically charged climate engulfing US-China relations.", "The freestyle skier competing in her first Olympics is also a straight 'A' student heading to Stanford in September, with an international modelling contract and endorsements currently worth around $US22 million ($30.8 million) a year.", "Dubbed the 'Snow Princess', you can't quite escape her, even when she's not competing. She is a brand ambassador for several of the major sponsors at the Beijing Winter Olympics, with her face adorning what seems like every other billboard.", "", "
Gu's commercial value is set to rise further following her success in Beijing.(Getty Images)
", "While born and raised in San Francisco, Gu decided in 2019 to compete for her mother's country of birth, China, which seemed logical given her connections to her grandparents in Beijing and a home where she spent significant portions of each year while growing up.", "Since then, she has won two Youth Olympic Games gold medals, two world championships, two X-games golds and is on her way to an Olympic medal collection.", "But the question most asked concerns who she 'really' is, as though somehow she cannot be both Chinese and American, that she doesn't have the right to call both home.", "\"I grew up spending 25-30 per cent of every year in China,\" Gu explained.", "\"As you guys (media) all know now from me answering questions, I am fluent in Mandarin and English, I am fluent culturally in both, I have family coming from Beijing, my mum grew up in Beijing \u2014\u00a0actually\u2026 there is a tower here you can see from the top of the [skiing] course and I can also see it from my house in Beijing.\"", "At a standing-room only media\u00a0conference after Gu won the first of what she hopes is three gold medals\u00a0\u2014\u00a0the free-ski\u00a0big-air event \u2014 some in the room were trying to get selfies, while others were more probing.", "\"You're trying to unite people through sports, which is a great thing, but you are not clear about whether you still have American citizenship and if you'll live in the US or China from now on,\" said one reporter, waiting for an answer to his statement.", "Another was a wolf in sheep's clothing question.", "\"I want to ask you to describe your emotions as you were doing the 1620:\u00a0how confident you were, was it a bit nerve wracking, and also for clarification\u2026 are you still a US citizen or how does that work?\"", "Becoming only the second female in history to land a 1620 \u2014 a trick with four-and-a-half rotations and two off-axis flips \u2014\u00a0is certainly newsworthy in a sporting sense.", "But Gu is far more than a sporting champion. She has become an internationally recognised face used in a propaganda battle. In a war, you must pick sides.", "To understand the political, cultural minefield Gu has jumped into at these Games, you only needed to look at the stands of those supporting her during her gold-medal run.", "Sitting front and centre in the sunshine at the Shougang Industrial Park was International Olympic Committee president Thomas Bach. Next to him was the allegedly disappeared Chinese tennis player, Peng Shuai, who has been incredibly visible at these Games.", "If you thought Gu would be intimidated or pressured by any of this there is no evidence of it in her public responses.", "In yet another version of the 'are you Chinese or are you American' question, posed as \"it must be difficult trying to keep both sides happy\", she replied:", "\"Here's the thing, I am not trying to keep anyone happy. I am an 18-year-old girl out here living my best life.", "\"Like, I am having a great time. So, it doesn't really matter if other people are happy or not because I feel as though I am doing my best, I am enjoying the entire process and I am using my voice to create as much positive change as I can for the voices who will listen to me in an area that is personal and relevant to myself.", "\"If other people don't really believe that's where I'm coming from then that just reflects that they do not have the empathy to empathise with a good heart, perhaps they don't share the same kinds of morals that I do and in that sense I'm not going to waste my time trying to placate [them].", "
'I know how difficult it is'
", "Offering a rare behind-the-scenes glimpse of the toll all the scrutiny and questioning might be taking, came these observations from American snowboard gold medallist Chloe Kim.", "Kim faced similar scrutiny when she emerged onto the Olympic stage with her Korean parents and their cultural ways, although she chose to compete for the US.", "\"Eileen is such a sweetheart,\" Kim said.", "\"I became really good friends with her over the past couple of years and I'm so proud of her. I know a lot of what she's going through and what she's dealing with right now.", "\"Her life probably changed completely, so I'm just doing my best to support her because I was at that place before and I know how difficult it is.\"", "", "
Gu clinched gold with her final run in the big-air decider.(Getty Images: Richard Heathcote)
", "On a day off, and needing some downtime, Gu travelled from Beijing into the mountains of Zhangjiakou to watch Kim defend her Olympic gold medal.", "\"I love that she came out here to support me and it's a beautiful friendship that we've started,\" Gu said.", "When Gu competes again on Sunday in Beijing\u00a0in the free-ski slopestyle qualification heats, there'll be wall-to-wall coverage throughout China, the US, and many other parts of the globe such is her current pulling power.", "Afterwards, no doubt, she'll be asked again to explain herself again: are you Chinese? Or are you American? Pick a side, because you cannot be loyal to both.", "Welcome to the world of global sports politics Eileen Gu. Enjoy the ride."]
